bug.short_desc: [1.8][compiler][null] Adding null annotation to return type causes IllegalStateException and sometimes InvocationTargetException

long_desc.thetext:
Thanks for the report. I can reproduce.
The direct cause of the exception is: we're trying to construct an annotated version of an IntersectionCastTypeBinding for "@Nullable List<Test.X> & @Nullable Set<Test.X>".
Needing to clone() an ICTB is unexpected and hence an implementation is missing. Might be as easy as adding indeed a clone() implementation to ICTB.
Srikanth, what do think?

Created attachment 245013 unit test
Here's the test from comment 0 converted into a JUnit test.
Retargetting to M2, as I don't expect to finish work on these before this week's build(s)
Thanks for the junit, Stephan. Fix and test released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=8bba2696b3d0dabadaa753b0a04baf4bf46c7c4c
Verified for 4.5 M2 using build I20140915-2000
